Plot: A dysfunctional family gathers together on Christmas for the first time since their mother passed away.
Production: On April 27, 2015, it was announced that Universal Pictures had bought the comedy script A Meyers Thanksgiving from David E. Talbert, who would also direct the film, with Will Packer producing through Will Packer Productions.[10] The film was retitled A Meyers Christmas, setting around the Christmas holidays.[11] On April 13, 2016, Universal Pictures announced another title change for the film, which will now be called Almost Christmas.[12]Principal photography on the film began on November 2, 2015 in Atlanta, Georgia.[13][14]
starring: Kimberly Elise|Omar Epps|Danny Glover|John Michael Higgins|Romany Malco|Mo'Nique|Nicole Ari Parker|J. B. Smoove|Gabrielle Union|Jessie Usher|DC Young Fly|
Release: Universal scheduled the film for an November 11, 2016 release.[11] A trailer for the film was released April 14, 2016.[15]
